attributes.label: Seawalls
attributes.description: Seawalls are a hard coastal defence used to prevent erosion of the shoreline. Seawalls are built along the shoreline to prevent sediment from washing away and to block wave energy from traveling up the beach. Seawalls can protect from flooding until overtopping occurs. Seawalls are an inflexible and unsustainable defence and are mainly used when critical infrastructure or development is occurring directly along the shoreline such as with railway lines or buildings. A more sustainable implementation of seawalls is to erect them further inland so that there is a buffer zone for coastal ecosystem processes to take place, but the seawall exists as a last line of defence.

attributes.label: Expand health education and risk communication associated with floods
attributes.description: Increase people’s education on flooding and the potential risks so they can invest, adapt and prepare.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Maintain, monitor and adapt energy infrastructure to improve efficiency
attributes.description: Energy infrastructure should be maintained, monitored and adapted if necessary to improve efficiency.

attributes.label: New or improved coastal defences
attributes.description: Coastal adaptation requires new or improved coastal defences to be implemented to protect low-lying land from coastal processes. The communities, properties, and assets cannot easily be relocated so coastal defences that work well with the surrounding landscape will ensure they remain viable. Government schemes to support adaptation will be crucial for providing resources to enact adaptation actions.

attributes.label: Incorporate a congestion charging zone within the clean air zone
attributes.description: Where traffic congestion is contributing to poor air quality, consider incorporating a congestion charging zone within the clean air zone.

attributes.label: Plant saltwater resilient crops in areas prone to seawater intrusion and coastal flooding
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Development and effective management of hedgerows and arable field margins
attributes.description: The management and planting of hedgerows and arable field margins provides multiple co-benefits and can increase biodiversity and agricultural productivity.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Use air pollution warning systems
attributes.description: The public, particularly vulnerable groups, could be informed of the air quality within their area, enabling them to take appropriate action in the event of increased air pollution.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Enhance community support
attributes.description: After a climate impact, the support, connections, and resources that stem from community interactions can significantly improve the recovery of individuals and the community as a whole. Vulnerable populations, such as people with disabilities, have better health outcomes when community resilience is high.

attributes.label: Expand education on food preparation, handling and safety
layer: Food and personal security in full
attributes.description:
An increase in temperature and humidity can increase food-related safety risks associated with climate change. Measures to increase education on food handling and safety can reduce the food safety risks. Additionally, increasing education on food preparation can increase people’s ability to change their diets to healthier and more sustainable options. 

Increasing skills and education on safe seafood handling, preparation and cooking, as well as the risks associated with toxins and viral and bacterial infections, can help to reduce the risk of exposure. Methods such as washing hands and surfaces thoroughly can also reduce the exposure risk associated with handling.

attributes.label: Artificial sand dunes and dune rehabilitation
attributes.description: Sand dunes occur when sand deposits itself at the edge of the barrier between land and the high tide line. Artificial sand dunes and dune rehabilitation aim to reduce erosion and flooding of the coastal lowlands. Dunes are an important coastal defence because they are dynamic and naturally adjust to sediment variations on the beach. Dunes can be rehabilitated by planting vegetation or building fences to help stabilise and trap sand. Dunes are a sustainable form of defence.

attributes.label: Accessible and affordable flood insurance provision
attributes.description: Insurance should be made available and accessible. Low income households are less likely to have insurance cover.

attributes.label: Soil monitoring and restoration
attributes.description:
Soil monitoring can help to identify where soil restoration is required. More investment could improve efficiency through the use of national-scale soil monitoring programmes and the monitoring of different management interventions which link to adaptation and mitigation.

It is important to increase soil health and therefore, improved advice for landowners and incentives to increase soil health could improve agricultural productivity.

Improving soil health can prevent erosion and runoff of agricultural pollutants and nutrients from entering aquatic ecosystems and reducing water quality.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Adapt water quality monitoring techniques to encompass a wide range of pathogenic organisms
attributes.description: Certain microorganisms such as Escherichia coli and Enterococci species are commonly used to test water quality, however, although they may be low in abundance, other microorganisms may be present which are not tested for. Therefore, testing for additional microorganisms, including those emerging through climate change, can provide a more accurate measure of water quality. Water testing should include a wide range of microorganisms and consider factors such as seasons, species and weather events such as flooding.

attributes.label: Effective monitoring, regulation, use and disposal of industrial and agricultural chemicals and biocides
attributes.description: Effective monitoring, regulation, use and disposal of industrial and agricultural waste, chemicals and biocides can limit the spread into the surrounding landscape and watercourses and reduce exposure to the associated negative impacts. Natural alternatives should be used for pesticides and fertilisers where possible to reduce the environmental impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Organise beach cleans and implement methods for removing plastics and pollution sources from marine environments
attributes.description:
Due to the hazardous nature of microplastics and chemical pollutants, methods to manage and remove plastic waste and litter from the environment are required. 

Beach cleans can help to reduce the abundance of litter within the environment. Additionally, removal of plastics from surface waters could help to limit the associated health impacts.

attributes.label: Make transport infrastructure more resilient
attributes.description: Transport infrastructure is susceptible to disruption from numerous climate impacts like heat, cold, and flooding. Increasing the resilience transport infrastructure improves wellbeing and protects vulnerable groups from being excessively affected by climate impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Promote efficient use of water
attributes.description: Efficient use of water can reduce individual volume use and limit scarcity of water supplies.

attributes.label: Adapt fishing industry to climatic change and ocean acidification
attributes.description: Adapting fishing practices to climate change can help to ensure that the fishing industry is resilient to change and limit exploitation. The arrival of new species due to warm temperatures could be considered as an opportunity to develop the fishing industry and aquaculture. Monitoring changes to identify potential impacts and opportunities can improve adaptation practices.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Ensure livestock are effectively managed to prevention and limit the spread of parasites, vectors and diseases
attributes.description: Measures to protect livestock from parasites, vectors and diseases can help to prevent and limit the spread of diseases.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Enhance community engagement
attributes.description: Successful climate adaptation requires communities engaging in understanding their local climate risks, the resources available to them, and the benefits of getting involved. Communities are able to reduce future risk and promote more sustainable futures with increased climate science literacy.

attributes.label: Improve housing quality and resilience measures considered in new developments
attributes.description: Improving the standards for new developments as well as for how existing houses are retrofitted or adapted to climate impacts will lead to direct benefits to health and wellbeing. Examples include building materials that recover from flood quickly, other wet floodproofing measures, dry floodproofing measures, renewable energy systems, low impact materials, and adequate ventilation.

attributes.label: Coastal setback
attributes.description: Coastal setback is a proactive decision to define a minimum distance from the shoreline that development may occur. These setbacks can be done to adapt to flooding, with elevation setbacks, or erosion, with lateral setbacks. Pursuing coastal setback allows for a buffer zone between the impending climate impacts and human infrastructure. A buffer zone will facilitate natural processes within the coastal ecosystem to ameliorate erosion and flooding.

attributes.label: Increase adaptation and resilience of healthcare services to climate change
attributes.description:
Guidance should be provided to enable healthcare services to adapt and increase resilience to climate change and the negative impacts. In addition to providing staff with training on mitigation and adaptation, this includes structural and policy measures.

A one health approach which considers the wider public health impacts holistically can help to ensure that the health sector is more resilient to climate change. Methods should be implemented to prevent illness, particularly non-communicable diseases which are often preventable, to reduce the burden of disease.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Community Relocation
attributes.description: Community relocation is a form of managed retreat. Some climate impacts, particularly along the coast, pose widespread threats to communities and will force proactive or reactive retreat depending on adaptive capabilities and decision-making. Although significant retreat options can reduce wellbeing and cultural ties, it may be a necessity in some communities. Other adaptation actions should be considered first, but relocation before climate impacts occur lessens the social and economic impact. If relocation is pursued, planning should ensure that disadvantaged populations are not displaced or left behind.

attributes.label: Routine monitoring of UK food security
attributes.description: Routine monitoring of food security is necessary to protect public health and minimize unnecessary costs for the health and social care system. Anticipating potential future climate risks which may impact the UK food system can help to ensure that public health impacts  are minimised and groups vulnerable  to food insecurity are protected. Food supply chain monitoring is necessary to ensure national and national supply networks are adequate and identify where adaptations are required.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Improve resilience of private water supplies
attributes.description: Scotland's private water supplies are at risk from climate impacts. Suggestions to improve the water supplies include risk assessments of water quality issues from various climate impacts, develop household water storage capacity in the event of drought or low water quality, monitor and anticipate water demand fluctuation, and consider centralized management of supply in rural areas.

attributes.label: Make space for water within urban environments
attributes.description: Spatial planning can help to reduce flood exposure by providing space for water to move within urban environments. Detention basins (water squares) can be designed  as multi-functional spaces during dry conditions and gradually store water in periods of high rain.

attributes.label: Make railway tracks more resilient to heat
attributes.description:
The UK rail industry will need to look at warmer climates overseas to consider how countries that operate railways in higher temperatures manage their infrastructure. For example, there may be a need to raise the stress-free temperature currently used in the United Kingdom or even to consider the approach of a seasonal re-stressing the rails for winter and summer.

Ensuring railway tracks are resilient to heat impacts, including thermal expansion and buckling, would reduce the vulnerability of the rail during hot weather. Sensitive electronic signal equipment should be installed appropriately so it does not overheat.

attributes.label: Accommodation approaches
attributes.description: The accommodate approach utilises physical changes to our infrastructure to protect from flooding and erosion as well as expanding our understanding of coastal processes and rapid responses to these events. These approaches rely on our ability to prepare and recover from extreme events while staying in vulnerable areas.

attributes.label: Make railway tracks more resilient to flooding and subsidence
attributes.description: Railways should be adapted where necessary to make them more resilient to flooding and subsidence.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Early flood warning systems
attributes.description: Early flood warning systems can increase the ability to plan and prepare in the event of heavy rainfall and potential flood events. People whose property or business is at risk of flooding can sign up for the free flood warning service.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Sustainable fishing practices and improved fisheries management
attributes.description: Sustainable fishing practices, such as limiting fishing of certain species if they decline or limited fishing in certain areas can prevent overfishing and may help stocks to recover. Monitoring of fisheries can help to guide decisions to improve stock resilience and sustainable fishing. Limiting the use certain fishing practices such as trawling and preventing waste such as old fishing nets from entering the sea can reduce negative impacts on marine environments.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase access to green and blue spaces
attributes.description: Increasing access to green and blue spaces provides multiple benefits to health and wellbeing.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Improve legislation to control the production and disposal of plastic and plastic waste
attributes.description: Improving legislation on the production and disposal of plastic and plastic waste can ensure that plastic is only produced when necessary and plastic waste is recycled or disposed appropriately.

attributes.label: Encourage a reduction in the proportion of unhealthy processed food in people's diets
attributes.description:
Food high in salt, sugar and unhealthy fats can be detrimental to health. Additionally, certain processing methods are associated with adverse health outcomes.
Reducing the proportion of processed food in people’s diets and improving processing methods  can limit exposure to the associated health impacts. This requires consideration of methods such as taxes on unhealthy ingredients, mandatory reporting for food companies and health education.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Use speed limits and average speed technology on the roadside
main_adaptation: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow
attributes.description: Speed limits and average speed technology on the roadside can promote a smoother driving style and speed reduction.

attributes.label: Increase the proportion of fruit, vegetables and plant-based food sources in people's diets
attributes.description: Increasing fruit and vegetables in people’s diets can provide numerous health benefits, however, this requires them to be affordable and accessible to consumers. Increasing the proportion of healthy plant-based foods in people’s diets is an adaptation measure because it can help people to become more resilient to certain health conditions exasperated by climate change and reduces pressure on land and water use, reducing the vulnerability of food systems.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Mediation of heat risk in care settings
attributes.description:
Risk mediation can involve adjusting daily routines and management and operating practices in care homes.

Care homes could benefit from simple measures incurring minimal or no cost at all, such as switching off unnecessary heat sources and applying rules for window opening and use of curtains.

attributes.label: Improve drainage for energy infrastructure in areas prone to flooding
attributes.description: Improving drainage in flood-prone locations can reduce energy supply disruption.

attributes.label: Introduce driver training to reduce emissions
attributes.description:
Consider introducing fuel-efficient driving as part of any test carried out when appointing or re-appraising staff who drive as part of their work.

Consider training staff drivers to reduce their vehicle emissions. This could include:
• reducing rapid accelerations and decelerations, and correct gear selection to improve fuel consumption
• switching off engines, if practical and safe, when parked by the roadside and when dropping off people or deliveries
• vehicle maintenance, including pumping up tyres to the recommended pressure
• emphasising that lower vehicle emissions will reduce both fuel costs and air pollution.

Consider using:
• 'in-vehicle' elements, for instance to ensure vehicles display real-time information about current fuel efficiency, appropriate gear selection and speed
• telematics technology to provide next-day information about driving style.

Consider monitoring fuel efficiency and providing feedback to drivers after training. This could include providing support from colleagues or 'buddies' to improve their driving style and rewards for those who drive efficiently.

Consider monitoring the fleet's fuel consumption and evaluating the local effect on air pollutant emissions to demonstrate the benefits of training on fuel use and air quality.

attributes.label: Identify and monitor areas at risk of flooding
attributes.description: Identifying and monitoring areas at risk of flooding can enable individuals and communities to prepare and adapt to flood risks.

attributes.label: Property flood resilience measures
attributes.description:
Structural and non-structural adaptation measures in buildings which improve building design can make them resilient to flooding and moisture if well designed and implemented successfully. However, adaptation measures should be carefully considered in relation to other climate change adaptation measures including energy efficiency,  ventilation, and passive cooling.

Strategies such as blocking water entry points, using water resistant paint, replacing carpets with non-porous materials and raising electrical points, meters and boilers above flood level can help to limit flood impacts to existing buildings.

New buildings should be designed with consideration of the climate change health impacts of the indoor environment and energy efficiency.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase regulation and transparency in food labelling
attributes.description: Increasing transparency in food labelling can increase people’s awareness of food products in relation to health and sustainability and enable them to make better choices on products which have less environmental and health impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Introduce clean air zones
attributes.description:
Consider introducing a clean air zone that: 
• includes restrictions or charges on certain classes of vehicle 
• supports zero- and low-emission travel (including active travel)
• includes targets to progressively reduce pollutant levels below EU limits and aim to meet World Health Organization air quality guidelines
• aims to reduce exposure to air pollution across the whole zone rather than focusing on air pollution hotspots.

attributes.label: Optimise coastal adaptations according to local landscapes
attributes.description: Adaptation actions must be optimised according to the surrounding landscapes. Depending on the strengths or weaknesses of the adjacent landscapes some adaptation actions are more likely to succeed than others. Applying coastal adaptations without careful consideration of the local environment and human infrastructure will result in failure, damage, and the destruction of ecosystems. Extensive knowledge of specific local processes, flood risk, and available resources must be gathered before employing adaptations.

attributes.label: Routine monitoring and treatment of seafood
attributes.description: Regulatory control measures should be used to monitor water quality in seafood harvest waters and high risk seafood such as oysters through microbiological analysis. Methods to minimise pathogens within shellfish can reduce the risk of infection.

attributes.label: Increase strategies and interventions to reduce food waste
attributes.description: Reducing food waste can reduce the need for additional production and potentially freeing‐up land which can be used for other practices. The highest percentage of food waste is from households, although manufacturers and hospitality also contribute significantly. Therefore, it is important to implement strategies to reduce waste, particularly within households.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Antimicrobial resistance planning
attributes.description: Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) is a worldwide threat that impacts morbidity, mortality, and socio-economic variables. The pressures of climate change will increase reliance on antibiotics to foster the health and wellbeing of people. Further planning to mitigate and prevent additional AMR consequences is necessary. The use of antimicrobial drugs in livestock and aquaculture should be limited due to its contributary impact.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Natural flood management strategies
attributes.description:
Natural flood management strategies provide multiple benefits and can mitigate flood risks by delaying and reducing peak flows. Natural flood management promotes the high adaptive capacity of ecosystems and the services they provide. 
Examples of natural flood management include
- woodland planting
- floodplain restoration
- sustainable urban drainage systems 
- coastal managed realignment

Natural flood management strategies can also be used to reduce the concentration of pollution entering aquatic ecosystems, for example, runoff attenuation features can help water quality through retention of pollution and sediment, thereby reducing the likelihood of chemicals, fertilisers, heavy metals and faecal bacteria travelling through runoff and into watercourses.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Consider including air quality monitoring and measures to reduce road-traffic-related emissions in  the R123 list of funding options for using the CIL
attributes.description: In consultation with local communities, consider including air quality monitoring and measures to reduce road-traffic-related emissions in the Regulation 123 list of funding options for using the Community Infrastructure Levy (see the Planning Portal information on the Community Infrastructure Levy).
main_adaptation: Manage development to mitigate road-traffic-related air pollution

attributes.label: Use traditional building materials for flood recovery
attributes.description: Traditional building materials, often found in historic buildings and homes, like wood and stone that receive minimal intervention after a flood recover quicker and with more resilience in the time after a flood compared to modern materials.

attributes.label: Passive cooling
attributes.description: Passive cooling is an approach that focuses on providing thermal comfort by controlling heat gains and heat dissipation without involving mechanical or electrical devices.

attributes.label: Installation of permeable pavements
attributes.description:
Permeable pavements can be composed of porous or non-porous blocks which are placed with spaces between and may include and aggregate layer below for drainage. 
Pavement surface temperature influences air temperature and is dependent upon the thermal properties of materials used. Permeable pavements can be used as an alternative to reduce the associated heat impacts. Permeable pavements can reduce flooding through increasing drainage capacity and limiting surface-water runoff and peak flow.

attributes.label: Manage development to mitigate road-traffic-related air pollution
attributes.description:
Actions to mitigate road-traffic-related air pollution include: 
• reducing the number of motorised trips through the development of local parking plans and supporting car clubs and active travel. 
• supporting zero- and low-emission vehicle use. 
• introducing and managing vegetation and street trees to encourage street ventilation.

attributes.label: Assess the resilience and robustness of land in relation to land use and changing water availability
attributes.description: Undertaking a comprehensive assessment of the robustness and resilience of land and water availability can enable measures to be undertaken to limit the adverse climate change impacts which impact agricultural and livestock production.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Take precautions for cyclists at busy roads
attributes.description:
Where busy roads are used consider:
• Providing as much space as possible between the cyclist and motorised vehicles.
• Using dense foliage to screen cyclists from motor vehicles, without stopping air pollution from dispersing or reducing the visibility or safety of cyclists near junctions. Also take into account concerns about personal safety.
• Reducing the time cyclists spend at highly polluted sites, including some junctions, where this can be done without increasing the time that other groups spend exposed to poor air quality.

attributes.label: Ocean-based climate interventions
attributes.description:
Ocean-based climate interventions are an area of adaptation actions that are not yet fully researched, but could hold promise for addressing some of the main causes of climate change such as greenhouse gas concentrations and warming surface temperatures. These actions are more likely to require national or international cooperation to be effective as well as a better understanding of the potential effects. Some examples include
- alkalinisation of the ocean to enhance carbon storage
- harnessing ocean energy in place of fossil fuels
- artificial upwelling to draw out heat from the atmosphere

attributes.label: Relevant retrofit of existing buildings
attributes.description:
Retrofit of existing buildings, especially if a multiple measure approach is taken, may protect housing and buildings from a range of climate impacts.Retrofit has to be carefully considered, as retrofit to net zero energy standards can cause an increase in risks to occupants and buildings. 
Some examples of retrofit actions include 
- insulation of walls 
- insulation of roofs
- insulation of floors
- replacing windows and doors
- increase airtightness
- make energy systems more sustainable 
- low flow water fittings
- renewable rooftop installation
- roof and wall coverings capable of resisting high winds
- protection for openings to resist wind, debris, and wind-driven rain
- structural systems that provide a path for loads from wind

attributes.label: Do not site buildings (such as schools, nurseries and care homes) in areas where pollution levels will be high
attributes.description: Minimise the exposure of vulnerable groups to air pollution by not siting buildings (such as schools, nurseries and care homes) in areas where pollution levels will be high.

attributes.label: Access to international surveillance of zoonotic diseases
attributes.description: Surveillance of infectious diseases can help with the identification of potential disease outbreaks and enable action to be taken if necessary. This is particularly important to reduce the risks in vulnerable populations. Community-based surveillance of infectious diseases can help to support with monitoring of zoonotic diseases.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Modify bridges vulnerable to flood damage and energy infrastructure contained within
attributes.description: Bridges vulnerable to flood damage and infrastructure contained within, such as pipes and cables, should be modified.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Expand health education and risk communication associated with heat and drought
attributes.description: Increasing education on the health impacts and risks associated with climate impacts can enable people to cope more effectively.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Combine “no active intervention” with soft-engineering responses to allow for sustainable coastlines
attributes.description: Combining nature-based solutions like restoring coastal habitats and ecosystem services alongside structural defences or soft-engineering responses will foster coastal infrastructure and create sustainable coastlines.

attributes.label: Managed realignment and habitat creation objectives
attributes.description: Managed realignment and habitat creation involves resetting the coastline further inland or preferably to higher ground. This process then creates space for new intertidal habitat to form alongside the previous line of coastal defences. Intertidal habitats contribute numerous ecosystem services to local communities, most importantly wave attenuation. Managed realignment and subsequent habitat creation better protect from shorelines and communities from coastal flooding and erosion.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Include information in the plan about how structures such as buildings and other physical barriers will affect the distribution of air pollutants
Assess the impact of any proposed charges on vulnerable groups
attributes.description: Assess the impact of any proposed charges (including exemptions for zero- and low-emission vehicles) on vulnerable groups.

attributes.label: Include air pollution in planning
attributes.description:
Include air pollution in 'plan making' by all tiers of local government, in line with the Department for Communities and Local Government's National Planning Policy Framework. This includes county, district and unitary authorities, as well as regional bodies and transport authorities. 

The Local Plan and other strategic planning processes (such as the core strategy, local transport plan, environment and health and wellbeing strategies) should include zero- and low-emission travel.

attributes.label: Access to rehabilitation services
attributes.description: After climate impacts occur, people with new or pre-existing disability, disease, or conditions will require rehabilitation through physical, mental, or occupational therapy. Access to these services is crucial for wellbeing.

attributes.label: Installation of reflective surfaces
attributes.description: Adaptation through design measures such as reflective surfaces can help to reduce overheating risks.

attributes.label: Expand education and provide advice to reduce exposure to low air quality
attributes.description: Measures to educate people how to reduce exposure to low air quality can limit negative health  impacts of air pollution and particulate matter.

attributes.label: Ensure livestock are provided with sufficient shade, ventilation and water
attributes.description:
Warmer temperatures are increasing the risk of livestock becoming exposed to heat stress. This can impact the productivity of livestock and increases the risk of mortality, particularly in dairy cattle. Therefore, it may be beneficial to select breeds which are able to cope well under hot conditions.

Shade can be provided in  multiple ways such as through tree cover and shelters , although ventilation in essential to increase the effect of cooling. Drinking water should be provided and access to ponds and rivers can increase the ability of livestock to cool themselves.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Provide a choice of cycle routes
attributes.description: Provide a choice of cycle routes, including routes that avoid highly polluted roads. Ideally use quiet streets or segregated routes.

attributes.label: Restore rivers, wetlands and floodplains
attributes.description: Restoring rivers, wetlands and floodplains can provide multiple benefits including natural flood management. Successful restoration requires a skilled workforce and public support.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Specify emission standards for private hire and other licensed vehicles
attributes.description: To reduce emissions within clean air zones, action could be taken to specify emission standards for private hire and other licensed vehicles.

attributes.label: Conserve and restore marine and coastal ecosystems
attributes.description: Conserving and restoring marine and coastal ecosystems can increase biodiversity, enable fish stocks to regenerate and provide multiple benefits of ecosystems services such as reduced coastal erosion. Highly biodiverse environments are also naturally more resilient to environmental changes such as invasive species and emerging pathogens, for example, seagrass produces natural biocides which inhibit pathogens and ameliorate human-origination bacteria from pollution in marine environments. Improving marine protected area networks requires the development of a strong regulatory framework.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase the efficiency of land use and management
attributes.description: Improving productivity of sectors including forestry and agriculture is essential for ensuring future domestic food security and for the UK’s land to be used successfully towards reaching Net Zero emissions targets. Increasing the efficiency in land use for all purposes within the UK can also help to identify measures which increase resilience to climate change impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Promote uptake of electric vehicles
attributes.description: Strategies for pollution reduction include the promotion of electric vehicles.

attributes.label: Increase knowledge and understanding of health outcomes associated with pathogenic marine microorganisms
attributes.description:
Improving knowledge of pathogenic microorganisms in marine environments and associated pathologies can enable doctors and healthcare staff to identify and apply appropriate treatment.
Improved public awareness, including the use of citizen science, can also increase people’s ability to take appropriate action to pathogenic microorganisms within the marine environment.

attributes.label: Land use planning
attributes.description: Land use planning should be an active element in coastline management in order to prevent lock-in or further damage if development occurs in areas at risk of flooding and erosion that are not adequately protected. Land use planning prevents further destruction of natural habitats, allows for more flexible adaptation options, and protects current and future infrastructure.

attributes.label: Use real-time information to tell drivers what the current optimum driving speed is
main_adaptation: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow
attributes.description: To promote a smoother driving style and speed reduction, in-vehicle elements can ensure vehicles display real-time information including current speed, appropriate gear selection and fuel efficiency.

attributes.label: Temporary restriction of beach access
attributes.description: Temporary restriction of access to beaches when harmful algal blooms and a high abundance of bacteria are present can reduce the number of people exposed and limit the risk of infection.

attributes.label: Monitor outside the clean air zone
attributes.description: Consider monitoring outside the zone to identify whether its implementation is causing problems in terms of traffic composition and flow. If so, address any issues identified. For instance, by changing the boundaries to address increased pollution at the margins of the zone or problems caused by diversion of traffic.

attributes.label: Restore Peatlands
attributes.description: Rewetted peatlands have the potential to provide various benefits including natural flood management and climate change mitigation, although peatland restoration should be undertaken based upon scientific research to avoid negative impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Expand education on vector-borne diseases
attributes.description: Increasing education on vector-borne diseases can enable people to take action to prevent or limit exposure, for example, strategies to educate people within rural areas can reduce exposure to ticks. Providing additional training to healthcare professionals can enable them to identify and respond to emerging vector-borne diseases.

attributes.label: Increase water-source storage capacity
attributes.description:
Increasing water storage capacity can ensure that reserves from excess winter rainfall are available during periods of water scarcity.

Harvesting of water, such a on-farm reservoirs could increase the ability to conserve groundwater resources to a sustainable level.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Action to minimise congestion caused by delivery schedules
attributes.description: To reduce emissions within clean air zones, action could be undertaken to minimise congestion caused by delivery schedules.

attributes.label: Provide charging points for electric vehicles
attributes.description: Providing charge points for electric vehicles in workplaces, commercial developments and residential areas, is a strategy for achieving zero- and low emission travel.

attributes.label: Action
Improve wastewater management systems
attributes.description: Wastewater systems should be maintained, and if necessary, adapted to reduce the risk of pollution leaking from sewerage systems during floods.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Expand health education and risk communication associated with drought
attributes.description: Increase people’s education on drought and the potential risks so they can invest, adapt and prepare.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase availability and accessibility to alternative protein sources
attributes.description:
To support the transition toward healthy and sustainable diets, it is essential to ensure alternative protein sources are available to consumers. Alternative protein sources such as microalgae, seaweed, plant proteins, edible insects  and cell-culture based proteins may provide suitable alternatives with a lower environmental impact; however, research should be undertake to ensure selected alternatives are appropriate.
Reducing demand for animal-based food products and increasing plant-based protein sources is an adaptation measure because it reduces pressure on land and water use and therefore, reduces the vulnerability of food systems to climate change.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Use a fleet recognition scheme
attributes.description: Such schemes help fleet operators improve efficiency by reducing fuel consumption and emissions: the system recognises operators who meet best operational standards.

attributes.label: Adapt agriculture and livestock production to a changing climate
attributes.description:
In order to increase the resilience of UK food systems, it is essential to adapt agriculture and livestock production to climate change. This can be supported by a change in consumption practices and sustainable farming and fishing techniques.

It may be beneficial to change farming techniques and transitioning to the most appropriate crop varieties could ensure that the most appropriate species are selected, for example, a warmer climate may provide opportunities to introduce new species. Livestock species which are able to cope better in high temperatures may also be more suitable to increase the resilience of livestock production.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Address emissions from public sector transport activities
attributes.description: Consider making low vehicle emissions (nitrogen oxides and particles) one of the criteria when making routine procurement decisions. This could include selecting low-emission vehicles, including electric vehicles.

attributes.label: Encourage public and private sector organisations to use zero- or low emission vehicles for deliveries
attributes.description: Encourage the use of zero- or low emission vehicles for deliveries to retail, office, residential or other sites in the clean air zone, particularly for the last mile of deliveries in city centres.

attributes.label: Management and surveillance of invasive non-native species
attributes.description: Management and surveillance of invasive non-native species can ensure action is taken to prevent negative impacts and reduce the spread where necessary.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Site and design new buildings, facilities and estates to reduce the need for motorised travel
attributes.description: The need for motorised travel could be reduced by considering the location and design of new estates, facilities and buildings when planning.

attributes.label: Installation of cool pavements
attributes.description: Cool pavements/roads with highly reflective coating reduces air temperatures near paved surfaces. Consider installing these in pedestrianized areas, cycling lanes and cycle hire stations. This is especially important in more urbanized areas.

attributes.label: Expand education on healthy and sustainable food choices
attributes.description: People’s dietary choices and diets are shaped by numerous systematic and social factors. Therefore, educational approaches which require lower level agency may be more effective, for example,  increased consumption of local and seasonal produce is a simple choice as long as it is accessible and affordable.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Dynamic Coast Project
attributes.description: Dynamic Coast Project is an example of a government supported coastal change and adaptation assessment. The project monitors coastal changes in order to build an evidence base that will impact future planning and action to protect infrastructure and other coastal assets. The project acts together with shoreline management plans, local plans, and national plans to create a cohesive understanding of climate impacts UK coastal areas will face.

attributes.label: Introduce bylaws and other action to support 'no vehicle idling' areas
attributes.description: This is particularly important where vulnerable groups congregate (such as outside schools, hospitals and care homes) and in areas where exposure to road-traffic-related air pollution is high.

attributes.label: Invest in and support the transition towards increasing renewable energy sources
attributes.description: Increasing energy production from renewable energy sources can increase resilience of UK energy systems and support the UK in meeting its goals to reduce greenhouse gasses and carbon emissions.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Coastal alert system
attributes.description: A coastal alert system should be incorporated into local or national adaptation planning efforts. A coastal alert system would forecast flooding, storm surge, and other coastal impacts due to these events. The creation of alert or warning systems, particularly for flooding, allows for the public to be alerted in advance of an event to minimise damage and for an appropriate response in the recovery stage.

attributes.label: Nature-based carbon storage
attributes.description: Nature-based carbon storage describes the capture of carbon emissions through vegetation and sediment like plants, trees, soil, or the ocean. Nature-based carbon storage is one of the most critical ecosystem services at risk with a changing climate.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Provision of cooling shelters
attributes.description: Cooling Centres are designated locations which provide people with a cool environment to escape the heat. Cooling centres may be air conditioned or passively cooled. Cooling shelters should be provided as a public health intervention to address heat risks within the community. Passive cooling shelters which do not rely on energy use should be selected where possible.

attributes.label: Maintain railway tracks
attributes.description: Ensuring the railway tracks are thoroughly maintained would reduce the vulnerability of the rail during hot weather.

attributes.label: Transition toward sustainable livestock feed options
attributes.description: In order to increase the sustainability of livestock production, it is essential to transition toward sustainable livestock options such as grazing. The UK currently imports a high percentage of animal feed. For example, soy-based animal feed, primarily from South America, is an important input for UK meat production, however, this contributes to deforestation and climate change.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Protection approaches
attributes.description: A protect approach utilizes hard and soft defences to protect the coastline from inundation, flooding, erosion, and storm surge.

attributes.label: Encourage active travel
attributes.description: Active transport, through methods such as walking and cycling, should be encouraged to promote health and wellbeing, as well as reducing air pollution associated with motorised travel.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Undertake further research and increase collaboration and knowledge exchange
attributes.description:
More high quality research is required in all areas on climate change risks and impacts to identify optimum adaptations and measure the effectiveness of different interventions. Interdisciplinary working can support knowledge exchange and ensure appropriate adaptations are implemented. It is essential that scientific knowledge is communicated effectively in order to influence change and provide optimal recommendations.

Ensuring researchers and stakeholders from different sectors collaborate can help to achieve more climate-resilient adaptations.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Plant suitable street trees in viable urban locations
attributes.description: Trees planted within urban environments can provide multiple benefits, including improving air quality and reducing flood risks, although species should be carefully selected.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Beach nourishment
attributes.description: Beach nourishment consists of adding sediment to a beach that has experienced a sediment deficit due to erosion or flooding. The addition of beach materials helps the beach maintain its natural width to provide an adequate barrier between sea and land. Nourishment can be implemented with dune restoration or creation to increase intertidal and inland protection. Beach nourishment addresses erosion by reducing incoming wave energy.

attributes.label: Conventional flood defence systems
attributes.description: Conventional flood defences should be maintained and if necessary, enhanced to protect areas at risk of flooding, particularly for buildings and infrastructure built within high flood-risk locations. In locations at an increased risk of flooding where natural flood management systems are not feasible, it may be necessary to build conventional flood defence systems.

attributes.label: Indoor mould prevention
attributes.description: Buildings should be designed and/or adapted to be robust against moisture and condensation to prevent and limit mould growth.

attributes.label: Promote sustainable production and consumption of goods
attributes.description: A shift in societal habits and behaviours towards sustainable production and consumption is required for a cleaner environment, because many production practices across a wide range of industries result in pollution which eventually enters  ecosystems and the ocean. A change in behaviour requires an increase in awareness of the impacts of unsustainable consumption.

attributes.label: Promote and implement sustainable food consumption and dietary change strategies
attributes.description: Strategies to promote sustainable food consumption and a transition toward sustainable diets could help in reducing the need for intensive food production methods and land use. However, this will require a transition toward more sustainable farming practices. Therefore, a whole systems approach which involves consumers, farmers, industries and governments is required.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Cold weather plans
attributes.description: To protect health and reduce harm through the prevention of avoidable cold weather effects on health, plans have been designed to improve the ability of the health and social care sector and associated partners to cope during periods of significant cold weather. Services provide alerts and a series of appropriate actions on the negative cold weather health effects, enabling people to respond and prepare appropriately, particularly for vulnerable populations.

attributes.label: Increase awareness and knowledge of antimicrobial resistance
attributes.description:
Awareness campaigns and training should be undertaken to increase people’s understanding of the risks associated with antimicrobial resistance and increase knowledge on how they can reduce the impacts.
Healthcare staff should be provided with education and training to increase their knowledge and enable them to manage antimicrobial resistance effectively.

attributes.label: Ensure legislation and policy is designed to meet food, health and sustainability goals
attributes.description: A strong legal framework with clear targets is essential to improve the food system and support the transition to healthy and sustainable diets. Subsidy and trade policies should align with those which promote healthy and sustainable diets. It is essential to ensure that corporations are guided by a strong legal framework which prioritises environmental sustainability, human health and wellbeing.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Access to international surveillance of pathogenic marine microorganisms
attributes.description: Improved surveillance and monitoring of pathogens can enable appropriate measure to be undertaken to limit exposure. Strategies to measure sea surface temperature can be employed to identify  and forecast areas at risk of an increase in bacterial abundance such as Vibrio spp., thereby enabling appropriate measures such as early warning systems to be applied to reduce and prevent infection. The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control has developed a global Vibrio spp. tool that provides 24-hour updated mapping data.

attributes.label: Support car sharing schemes or car clubs
attributes.description: Supporting car sharing schemes or car clubs is a strategy for achieving zero- and low emission travel.

attributes.label: Flood-proofing
attributes.description: Flood-proofing measures contribute to property flood resilience measures. Flood-proofing is the process of making buildings more resilient to flood by either preventing water from getting in or minimising the damage if water does enter. The first method is considered dry flood-proofing while the second is wet flood-proofing.

attributes.label: Government schemes for energy costs
attributes.description: Government schemes for the cost of energy will support those in fuel poverty so that they do not suffer the detrimental effects of inadequately heated homes. The schemes can improve energy efficiency measures like insulation, allocate loans for energy cost, or give one-off payments as offered in winter 2022/2023.

attributes.label: Reconsider hold the line and hard coastal defences
attributes.description: Hold the line is a coastal defence that aims to maintain the position of the shoreline as is and prevent further retreat inland. This is often accomplished with hard and soft engineering tactics. Hold the line policies prevent coastal and marine ecosystems from naturally adapting to sea level rise and erosion. The resulting loss in habitats and natural defences will have significant impacts on human infrastructure and life. Hard coastal defences, like concrete seawalls and groynes, create further lock-in of coastal infrastructure and adaptation.

attributes.label: Use methods to limit pathogens in sewage and agricultural and urban runoff from entering the environment and coastal waters
attributes.description:
Methods should be employed to prevent and reduce urban and agricultural runoff from entering aquatic environments including:
- increased efficiency of farming and the use of fertilisers and pesticides.
- improved management of wastewater.
- implementation of natural flood management strategies that limit the flow of water during heavy rainfall events.

attributes.label: Increase biodiversity
attributes.description: Biodiverse ecosystems are more resilient to climate change and provide multiple ecosystem services. Biodiversity can be increased through protecting existing ecosystems by reducing negative pressures which enable natural regeneration. Where  keystone native species have been lost, the careful reintroduction into viable sites can enable the ecosystem to function more effectively.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow
attributes.description: To promote smooth traffic flow, it is beneficial to introduce and promote strategies to encourage a smooth driving style.

attributes.label: Measures to increase air quality
attributes.description: Measures should be undertaken to increase air quality and reduce the associated negative health impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Avoid restricting ventilation in streets
attributes.description: Manage street trees and vegetation to reduce the risk of restricting street ventilation, where this may contribute to poor air quality - for instance, by the choice of species, siting and pruning regimes. Trees and vegetation can be planted in open spaces or as 'green' walls or roofs.

attributes.label: Use signs that display a driver's current speed to reduce unnecessary accelerations
main_adaptation: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow
attributes.description: Installing signs that display a driver's current speed can encourage a smoother style of driving, with less decelerations and accelerations.

attributes.label: Shoreline management plans
attributes.description: Shoreline management plans (SMPs) are a strategic approach to fostering a sustainable coastline in the short, medium, and long term. SMPs assess the evidence for current and future coastal processes and changes in order to provide guidance to local, regional, and national bodies. The use and revisement of SMPs ensures that the evidence and recommendations are up to date as shorelines evolve and climate projections become clearer. This will allow better outcomes for coastal populations and environments.

attributes.label: Increase the resilience and transparency of food supply chains
attributes.description:
Increasing the resilience and transparency of food supply chains can limit disruption and increase the resilience of UK food systems. Ensuring transport is resilient to climate change impacts can help to limit impacts to food supply and distribution, although encouraging local and seasonal produce can reduce pressure on transportation networks and reduce emissions in some cases.
The development of insurance instruments to protect domestic and international food supply chains. Access to a broad range of international food markets can help to ensure networks are more resilient to disruption.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Ensure adequate mental health service provision
attributes.description: Mental healthcare services should be adequate to reduce the negative health impacts and associated physical health conditions.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Use pollen count public warning systems
attributes.description: Pollen count warning systems can enable people to take action when pollen forecasts are high.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Identify alternatives to plastic products
attributes.description: Exploring potential sustainable alternatives to plastics could reduce the abundance of plastics entering the environment.

attributes.label: Rapid establishment and provision of healthcare services during and after floods
attributes.description: Establishing health clinics to people experiencing or who have experienced flooding can ensure adequate healthcare service provision.

attributes.label: Increase the efficiency of agricultural management and production strategies
attributes.description:
Productive agricultural and livestock output is essential for food security and to achieve Net Zero emissions targets. To maintain and enhance agricultural output, improved cropland management which does not require more land use is essential. Methods such as precision farming can reduce the demand for land conversion and potentially free up land for other practices. Sustainable practices which increase the productivity of livestock through efficient feed and care can also improve land use. On-farm measures such as the reporting of food waste could help with the identification of drivers of spoilage and create data which can be used to provide solutions.

Methods such as regenerative farming, precision farming methods, cover cropping and reduced tillage, can increase soil health and reduce soil erosion and agricultural runoff, reducing agricultural pollutants from entering aquatic ecosystems
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Rapid disease risk assessment
attributes.description: A rapid disease risk assessment by a multi-agency group after a climate impact ensures that the damage and risk of affected individuals is accounted for so that they can be relocated or given appropriate relief and services. Specifically, disease risk assessment can prevent infectious disease, like those that occur after floods, from exacerbating the hazards of the climate impact as individuals recover.

attributes.label: Use heatwave warning systems
attributes.description:
Analyses of the benefits and costs of heatwave warning systems indicate high benefit to cost ratios for future heat related mortality. Under climate change, benefit to cost ratios become even higher.

Heatwave plans are good at protecting people during the alert periods (hottest days), but less effective in weather where no alert is issued. Evidence highlights that people are not always taking heed of the advice about hot weather. Overall, the general public feel positive about warm summer days and most do not feel that hot weather is a risk to their health, including people over the age of 75. As a consequence, many people, including the most vulnerable, are not taking all of the Heatwave Plan's recommended actions to protect themselves and others.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Encourage drivers to maintain a reduced, steady pace where physical speed reduction measures are used
attributes.description: Where physical speed reduction measures are used to reduce road danger and injuries (20 mph zones), consider using them to encourage drivers to maintain a reduced, steady pace along the whole stretch of road, rather than road humps that may increase acceleration- and braking-related emissions.
main_adaptation: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow

attributes.label: Wildfire prevention and management strategies
attributes.description: Wildfire prevention and management strategies can help to reduce the likelihood of fires from starting and spreading. Land can also be managed to reduce wildfires from spreading through techniques such as grazing and wetland restoration, although these methods need to be implemented appropriately. Limiting use of barbeques and fires during dry periods can reduce the changes of fires from starting. It is also beneficial to increase awareness wildfire risks and implications.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Develop local parking plans
main_adaptation: Manage development to mitigate road-traffic-related air pollution
attributes.description: The development of local parking plans can mitigate road-traffic-related air pollution.

attributes.label: Sea dikes
attributes.description: The main purpose of sea dikes, also known as levees or floodbanks, is to protect low-lying coastal areas from inundation. The structures attenuate wave energy, resist high water pressure, and minimise overtopping. Sea dikes are a hard defence and reduce the dynamic ecosystems they occupy. However, in particularly at risk areas, these structures provide critical protection. The failure of sea dikes can be catastrophic in extreme conditions.

attributes.label: Introduce 20 mph limits without physical measures to reduce speeds in urban areas where average speeds are already low
attributes.description: Introducing 20 mph limits without physical measures to reduce speeds in urban areas where average speeds are already low (below around 24 mph) will avoid unnecessary accelerations and decelerations.
main_adaptation: Introduce actions to smooth traffic flow

attributes.label: Improve disposal and recycling of plastic waste
attributes.description: Methods for collecting and recycling plastic waste should be improved to ensure a higher volume of plastic waste can be reused. Where it is not possible to recycle plastics, appropriate methods of disposal should be employed.

attributes.label: Fungal and plant disease resistant crop management
attributes.description:
Methods to reduce fungal and disease resistance in crops can reduce the adverse effects associated with climate-related impacts such as increasing temperatures and humidity. Practices such as crop rotation can reduce the risk of fungal infections, and removing waste such as stubble and crop debris can lower the risks from potential sources of infection. Mixed crop techniques where multiple crop varieties are grown together can reduce the spread of fungal spores and can make some crops more resistant to pests. Some crop species may benefit from being covered to reduce the spread of spores, although ventilation is generally required to minimise infection.

Fungicide and disease treatments may be required, although natural alternatives should be used where possible to reduce the environmental impacts.
Planting genetic crop varieties which are resistant to disease and fungal infections may be beneficial.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Development of green and blue infrastructure
attributes.description:
Development of green infrastructure is the strategic addition of plant cover to urban spaces. Plant cover refers to how much of a given area is covered by vegetation (as opposed to human-made structures). It is a measure of land use in urban areas.

The best application of plant cover is through planting trees, preferably aligned, which provide local benefit, while grass can affect heat accumulation and help to maintain an adequate surface temperature.  Vegetation placement and the design of urban green infrastructure should be justified and applied where it most efficiently reduces exposure to heat stress, such as in green cycling/walking corridors. Green and blue infrastructure can also be designed to absorb rainwater, reducing and flow rate and volume. A reduction in flow can also reduce the likelihood of pollution from urban environments from contaminating watercourses. 

Plant and tree species should be selected based upon the requirements of the local area and consideration of how certain species, such as allergenic species, may impact health during the pollen season.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Retreat approaches
attributes.description: A retreat approach is a planned withdrawal or relocation from vulnerable areas to reduce impacts.

attributes.label: Encourage a reduction in meat consumption
attributes.description: To support the transition toward healthy and sustainable diets, it is essential to reduce the amount of meat and animal products in people’s diets, particularly processed meat associated with adverse health impacts, and red meat associated with adverse health and environmental effects. Reducing meat consumption is an adaptation measure because it reduces pressure on land and water use and therefore, reduces the vulnerability of food systems to climate change. However, it is important to ensure that sufficient consumption of macro and micronutrients is achieved for a balanced healthy diet.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Site living accommodation away from roadsides
attributes.description: Living accommodation should be sited away from roadsides when planning.

attributes.label: Improve water quality monitoring
attributes.description:
Water quality monitoring can be used to identify where water quality improvements are required.

It is important to monitor water quality within aquifers to assess whether saline intrusion risks are increasing in coastal regions.

Contaminants and pathogens from sources including pharmaceutical, agricultural, industrial and domestic waste can enter water systems, therefore,  water quality monitoring can be used to identify whether these are present in potential harmful quantities.

Due to the ability of many pathogenic microorganisms to inhabit beach sand and sediment, beaches could be tested and monitored to identify the abundance of pathogenic microorganisms.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Contingency planning for risks associated with emerging and novel pathogens
attributes.description: Contingency planning for risks associated with emerging and novel pathogens can help to identify potential risks and plan for appropriate action.

attributes.label: Reintroduce beavers into viable sites
attributes.description: The introduction to beavers in viable sites can enable them to provide natural flood management services. Research suggests beaver behaviour reduces peak flows, with dams decreasing average flood flows, trapping sediment and increasing biodiversity. During periods of drought, water slowed and stored by dams can protect local ecosystems by ensuring they have access to water.

attributes.label: Advance the line
attributes.description: Advance the line, also known as land claim, is an aggressive coastal plan. This tactic is used to expand the available land for agriculture or development. Advancing the line usually destroys intertidal habitats and contributes to the decline of coastal ecosystems. This form of coastal protection should only be done if absolutely necessary.

attributes.label: Provide support for active travel
attributes.description: Active travel should be supported through investment in strategies that increase opportunities for physical activity, such as developing green infrastructure and walking and cycling networks.

attributes.label: Encourage outdoor recreational activities and time spent within green and blue spaces
attributes.description: Outdoor recreational activities and time spent within green and blue spaces provide multiple health and wellbeing benefits, including improving immunity. However, care should be undertaken to reduce exposure to hazards and pathogens within the environment which may impact health.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Avoid the creation of street canyons
attributes.description: Reduce exposure to pollution by avoiding the creation of street and building configurations (such as deep street canyons) that encourage pollution to build up where people spend time.

attributes.label: Installation of external shading and shutters
attributes.description: External shutters are found to be very effective in decreasing overheating in buildings. However, they may not be practical in some houses because, in the UK, many windows open outwards.

attributes.label: Resilience monitoring and horizon-scanning to identify likely and potential climate change threats and impacts
layer: Food and personal security in full
attributes.description: Improved surveillance, horizon-scanning, and modelling capability through international collaboration is required for identification and management of emerging pathogens

attributes.label: Poor water quality warning systems and pollution alerts
attributes.description:
Certain microorganisms that are pathogenic to humans, such as many algae and bacteria, play an important role in nitrogen and carbon cycling and are primarily endemic in aquatic environments, therefore, it is not feasible to eradicate them to reduce infection risk. 

Monitoring and early warning systems can be used to predict outbreaks and ensure appropriate action is undertaken. The posting of beach warnings after heavy rainfall events could also limit exposure to contaminated water from land runoff, waterways and sewage discharge.

attributes.label: Encourage regular physical activity
attributes.description: Regular physical activity provides multiple health and wellbeing benefits, including improved immune function. Regular physical activity can support healthy aging and thermoregulatory capacity, in addition to preventing obesity and associated non-communicable diseases.

attributes.label: Enhance drought monitoring and early warning systems
attributes.description: Drought monitoring and warning systems can help to identify the emergence of drought and increase the ability to prepare.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase sanitation and infection control measures
attributes.description: Increasing sanitation, hygiene and infection control measures can reduce the risks associated with emerging diseases and antimicrobial resistant microorganisms.

attributes.label: Enhance knowledge and capacity building for adaptation techniques
attributes.description: Knowledge and capacity building for adaptation techniques is an essential element to successful climate adaptation actions. Adaptation decisions rely on understanding the potential pathways of different climate impacts. Examples of essential knowledge include predicted sea level rise, existing local protection, or the coastal topography indicating areas at risk. Alongside knowledge of risk, knowledge of adaptation techniques and the characteristics of the local area for successful implementation are necessary. One example is the importance of knowing local sediment characteristics. Sediment characteristics can influence beach nourishment, dune construction, and even tourism.

attributes.label: Develop sustainable drainage systems
attributes.description:
Sustainable drainage systems (SuDS) can be incorporated to manage water flow and reduce the risk of flooding, unless clear evidence suggests that this would be inappropriate.
Some techniques for implementing SuDS include
- greening like green roofs
- permeable surfaces like pavements 
- water storage like rainwater harvesting
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Improvement of ventilation
attributes.description:
Buildings should be designed and adapted to ensure that they are adequately ventilated through either mechanical or preferably natural strategies which enable airflow and maintain rooms at optimal temperatures internally. Building infrastructure should also be designed to enable external airflow through streets, particularly within urban environments.

Improved indoor ventilation can reduce mould-growth and  moisture associated with flooding and heavy rainfall.

attributes.label: Utilise adaptation pathways, thresholds, and tipping points in adaptation planning
attributes.description: Climate adaptation should be undertaken as soon as possible, but it is difficult to determine when, where, and what the exact impacts will be. By considering the thresholds and tipping points associated with ecosystems and our climate, adaptation pathways that are dynamic and active allow for immediate short-term action while also fostering frameworks for long-term action. Climate adaptation plans should be multifaceted with different scenarios and aims depending on the outcome of global policy and climate events. This allows for flexibility in choosing the correct adaptation actions depending on changing pressures.

attributes.label: Surveillance of flood-related health impacts
attributes.description: Surveillance of flood-related health impacts can enable healthcare services to prepare and respond appropriately.

attributes.label: Identify which classes of vehicles to restrict or charge in a clean air zone
attributes.description: Identify which classes of vehicles to restrict or charge in a clean air zone based on an understanding of local conditions (such as local sources of road-traffic-related pollution and factors influencing dispersion). Use nationally recognised vehicle types (such as the Euro classification for diesel and petrol vehicles).

attributes.label: Multi-Hazard Early Warning System
attributes.description: A Multi-Hazard Early Warning System (MHEWS) is part of the Early Warnings for All action plan that was set forth by the United Nations to ensure that everyone is covered by an early warning system within five years. MHEWS is an interconnected approach to the knowledge, observations, preparedness, and warning communication required to adequately address hazards of climate impacts.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase tree and woodland cover in viable locations
attributes.description: Woodland creation and tree planting within viable locations can provide multiple benefits, however, appropriate spatial planning is required to avoid the potential loss of existing habitats such as peatlands, grasslands and heathlands. Tree species should be carefully selected based upon the location considered.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Community-focused adaptation strategies
attributes.description: Communities and individuals should be educated on how they can take action for both climate change adaptation and mitigation strategies and become more resilient.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Promote healthy food consumption
attributes.description: Diets that are optimal for environmental and both humans have an appropriate caloric and nutritional intake and consist of low amounts of processed food, added sugars, unsaturated fats, refined grains, animal source foods and high in plant-based foods. These food sources generally rely on less land used for production. Healthy food consumption should be promoted to minimise the adverse health impacts associated with an unhealthy diet and increase people's resilience to health impacts associated with climate change.  A Healthy gut microbiota is also important for modulating people's metabolic responses and ensuring they have a healthy immune system. However, a strong legal framework, education and interventions are required to support the transition to a healthy diet.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Improve food storage strategies to reduce spoilage
attributes.description:
Many foods are especially susceptible to waste during storage, transportation, and processing. Factors such as high humidity and temperature can increase food storage risks and certain foods such as met, dairy, fish, fruit and vegetables are particularly vulnerable to climate hazards.

Food industries should consider advanced technologies capable of reducing spoilage and maintaining the nutritional content of food at all stages from harvesting to consumption. However, sustainable food processing should be considered where possible to minimize food waste and limit negative health impacts. A reduction in food loss and waste is an adaptation measure which contributes to a reduction in food demand and land use.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Improve regulation on the marketing of unsustainable and unhealthy food products
attributes.description: Improving regulation on the marketing of unsustainable and unhealthy food can help to limit people from making poor food choices. Working with food processors to amend recipes and make products less unhealthy could limit the negative impact on the food industry.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Installation of internal blinds or curtains
attributes.description: Internal blinds or curtains can be installed as a passive cooling measure to reduce internal heat.

attributes.label: Increase efficiency of treated water systems
attributes.description: Ensure treated water systems are regularly maintained and enhanced to increase efficiency, limit leakage and increase efficiency.

attributes.label: Plan adaptation work to protect electricity substations and infrastructure
attributes.description: Electricity substations and infrastructure should be adapted to protect them where there is a known or potential risk of flooding.

attributes.label: Ensure access to affordable healthy food
attributes.description: Increasing access to healthy and affordable food can increase people’s ability to choose health options, particularly for those living in low-income households.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Storm surge barriers
attributes.description: Storm surge barriers are a hard defence implemented to prevent coastal flooding. Storm surge barriers may be movable or fixed and are closed when extreme water levels are predicted. Storm surge barriers protect inlets, rivers and estuaries by blocking incoming storm surges keeping upstream water levels low and reducing flooding.
