Most storm surge barriers are movable to allow for normal tides to flow as well as access for shipping and transport.

attributes.label: Promote risk identification
attributes.description: Risk identification before and after a climate impact ensures that vulnerable groups in the population are recognized, assisted, and receive adequate care. Community risk registers allow for those helping in recovery to deliver necessary services like medical care, equipment, or relocation of those most at risk.

attributes.label: Energy efficient household heating interventions
attributes.description: Energy efficient household heating interventions promote lower carbon fuel use as well as lowering energy bills. Energy efficient heating upgrades include draught-proofing, replacing windows and doors, installing heating controls, insulation, solar panels, and switching to a heat pump. Although these interventions will help increase temperature control if they are implemented improperly or not maintained they can lead to health effects due to reduced ventilation.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Use constructed wetlands for water pollution control
attributes.description: Constructed wetlands are artificial wetlands which are designed to used natural ecosystem services to treat stormwater runoff, wastewater and sewage.

attributes.label: Communicate heat health action plans
attributes.description: Heat health action plans should be communicated to ensure interventions are effectively implemented.

attributes.label: Mechanical cooling
attributes.description: Mechanical cooling examples include air conditioning and active cooling heat pumps. However, passive cooling techniques which do not rely on energy use should be selected where possible.

attributes.label: Emergency planning and response to extreme flood events
attributes.description: Emergency planning policies can ensure appropriate preparation, response and recovery in the event of extreme floods.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Increase the resilience of UK food systems
attributes.description:
Food systems consist of activities including initial production, harvesting, storage, transportation, processing, distribution, consumption,  marketing and  regulation, in addition to factors such as environment, socio-economic, nutritional and health outcomes. and the environment. 

To ensure food security, it is essential to increase the resilience and sustainability of UK food systems to a changing climate. Measures such as adapting agricultural and livestock production to climate change and improving supply chains can help to increase resilience.

Resilience can be improved through strong domestic production and a diverse range of goods from international suppliers. It is also important to ensure that sustainable and resilient food systems are able to provide diets that are diverse and are optimal for human health.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Develop integrated public transport networks based on low-emission vehicles
attributes.description: Integrated public transport networks include park and ride schemes.

attributes.label: Increase awareness of hygiene methods to reduce infection during and after seawater exposure
attributes.description: People should be educated to increase their awareness of methods to prevent and limit infection during and after seawater exposure. Waterproof bandages can be used to cover open wounds, particularly in people who are old and immunocompromised. Once out of the water, skin and new wounds can be washed to remove marine pathogens.

attributes.label: Access to international surveillance systems for vector-borne diseases
attributes.description: Vector monitoring and disease surveillance are important strategies for addressing the risk from vector-borne diseases. Exit from the European Union may undermine actions to control vector-borne diseases through reduced access to international surveillance systems. Therefore, adaptation to the risks associated with emerging vector-borne diseases requires improved surveillance of diseases and vectors to enable early detection. Additionally, regularly updated risk assessments on the likelihood of cases and outbreaks of an emerging disease and increased preparedness for outbreaks can help to reduce and manage the effects.
layer: Food and personal security in full

attributes.label: Avoid the development of buildings in flood risk areas
attributes.description: Building in areas at risk of flooding increases people’s exposure risk, particularly in areas such as floodplains. Avoiding building in areas with a history of flooding or at an increased future risk can limit exposure.

attributes.label: Work across local authority boundaries to address regional air pollution
attributes.description: It is important to address regional air pollution and prevent migration of traffic and emissions to other communities, resulting in areas of poor air quality.

attributes.label: Installation of cool and green roofs
attributes.description:
Cool roofs are made of building materials that are highly reflective and emissive of heat, while green roofs are composed of a vegetative layer grown on the roof surface that lowers the temperature on the rooftop and in the surrounding air through shade and evapotranspiration. Both cool and green roofs offer alternatives to traditional building practices that provide long term improvements and adaptations to excess heat potentially reducing urban heat island effects.

Green roofs can help to absorb water and reduce rainfall run-off and peak flow, reducing the risk of flooding and pollution for contaminating aquatic ecosystems.

attributes.label: Conserve and maintain existing green and blue spaces
attributes.description: Existing green and blue spaces should be maintained to provide ecosystem services.
layer: Food and personal security in full
